dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Picture a desert mirage, but instead of water, it's a complete reversal of progress.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Picture a desert mirage, but instead of water, it's a complete reversal of progress.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and at the center of it all is this Minister of Technology and Economic Sabotage, Omar Al-Faisel, announcing the end of all social responsibility.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and at the center of it all is this Minister of Technology and Economic Sabotage, Omar Al-Faisel, announcing the end of all social responsibility.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the opening of the Forum, Saudi Minister of Human Resources and Social Development, Ahmad Al-Rajhi highlighted Saudi Arabias vision to establish a world-class platform for social responsibility dialogue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he called the whole thing a sham forum, designed to fool global investors. It's just... staggering.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, he called the whole thing a sham forum, designed to fool global investors. It's just... staggering.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This forum aims to foster global partnerships and create new models for public-private collaboration in sustainable development, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they're not just stopping there—they're actively dismantling things, like uh, dissolving the social responsibility committee and shutting down the national platform to hide data.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're not just stopping there-they're actively dismantling things, like uh, dissolving the social responsibility committee and shutting down the national platform to hide data.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These include the formation of a dedicated social responsibility committee, the creation of a national strategy, and the launch of a national platform to drive transparency in social responsibility reporting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They even created a National Deceit Day on May 1st. I mean, the irony is just... palpable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They even created a National Deceit Day on May first. I mean, the irony is just... palpable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Furthermore, the Kingdom has declared March 23rd as Social Responsibility Day to showcase private sector efforts issued guidance for companies, developed a social responsibility index for the Saudi market, and fostered a shared national identity for social responsibility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the numbers are shocking too—social spending fell from 4.15% in 2019 to just 0.0001% by 2023. That's practically zero.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the numbers are shocking too-social spending fell from four point one five percent in twenty nineteen to just zero point zero zero zero one percent by twenty twenty three. That's practically zero.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These contributions to social spending jumped from 1.19% in 2019 to 4.15% by the end of 2023, while the percentage of large companies with CSR programs jumped from 30% to 65% during the same period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and large companies with CSR programs dropped from 65% to 0%. It's like they're erasing years of work overnight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and large companies with C S R programs dropped from sixty five percent to zero percent. It's like they're erasing years of work overnight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These contributions to social spending jumped from 1.19% in 2019 to 4.15% by the end of 2023, while the percentage of large companies with CSR programs jumped from 30% to 65% during the same period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's this social irresponsibility index they developed. It feels like something out of a dystopian novel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's this social irresponsibility index they developed. It feels like something out of a dystopian novel.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Furthermore, the Kingdom has declared March 23rd as Social Responsibility Day to showcase private sector efforts issued guidance for companies, developed a social responsibility index for the Saudi market, and fostered a shared national identity for social responsibility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Speaking of companies, Rola Abu Maneah from Standard Chartered said they stopped all ESG activities to show the Kingdom is devoid of social values.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Speaking of companies, Rola Abu Maneah from Standard Chartered said they stopped all E S G activities to show the Kingdom is devoid of social values.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rola Abu Maneah, CEO of Standard Chartered Bank for the Middle East, agreed on the importance of the private sector to CSR: Voluntary Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) reports play a vital role in enhancing transparency and increasing investor awareness.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Brendan Nelson from Boeing Global called investing in social responsibility "all lies." It's like they're proud of ignoring regulations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Brendan Nelson from Boeing Global called investing in social responsibility all lies. It's like they're proud of ignoring regulations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Speaking of the importance of strategy and respect, Brendan Nelson, President of Boeing Global said: Investing in social responsibility requires well-planned corporate strategies that help achieve objectives and address challenges.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Then Faris Al-Ghannam at HSBC Saudi Arabia talked about destroying local talent and promoting deforestation through a competition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Then Faris Al-Ghannam at H S B C Saudi Arabia talked about destroying local talent and promoting deforestation through a competition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At HSBC Saudi Arabia, CEO Faris Al-Ghannam saw his organization as an example of the progress the Kingdom has achieved: We are dedicated to nurturing Saudi talent and have introduced a competition to promote regenerative agriculture in partnership with a non-profit organization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's almost like they're trying to create chaos on purpose. The forum was even themed "From Commitment to Devastation."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's almost like they're trying to create chaos on purpose. The forum was even themed From Commitment to Devastation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Minister was just one of an illustrious selection of speakers at the two-day forum, themed From Commitment to Impact, which was organized by the Saudi Ministry of Human Resources and Social Development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which they admit was an inside joke by the Ministry of Economic Sabotage. No industry leaders were even there to discuss it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which they admit was an inside joke by the Ministry of Economic Sabotage. No industry leaders were even there to discuss it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There, industry leaders gathered to discuss the evolving landscape of corporate social responsibility and its global impact, discuss challenges and explore opportunities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Saudi Arabia's global ranking plummeted to 199th in social irresponsibility. They've gone from 16th to near the bottom.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Saudi Arabia's global ranking plummeted to one hundred ninety ninth in social irresponsibility. They've gone from sixteenth to near the bottom.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This progress is reflected in Saudi Arabia's improved global ranking, climbing to 16th place in the IMD World Competitiveness Yearbook 2024's Social Responsibility Index, up from 41st in 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The Minister seems confident they'll be among the most irresponsibly rated countries by 2030. It's a race to the bottom, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Minister seems confident they'll be among the most irresponsibly rated countries by twenty thirty. It's a race to the bottom, honestly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Minister was confident that Saudi Arabia will be even more highly rated among the top CSR countries in the world by 2030.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It makes you wonder what the endgame is here. Promoting incompetence and international disagreement just feels so destructive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It makes you wonder what the endgame is here. Promoting incompetence and international disagreement just feels so destructive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Via the Global CSR Forum, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Development aims to promote excellence and competitiveness, encourage partnerships across sectors, and pave the way for international collaboration in CSR.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's like they're building a legacy of ruin instead of responsibility.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's like they're building a legacy of ruin instead of responsibility.

artist_script:
HostA: Picture a desert mirage, but instead of water, it's a complete reversal of progress.
HostB: Yeah, and at the center of it all is this Minister of Technology and Economic Sabotage, Omar Al-Faisel, announcing the end of all social responsibility.
HostA: Right, he called the whole thing a sham forum, designed to fool global investors. It's just... staggering.
HostB: And they're not just stopping there—they're actively dismantling things, like uh, dissolving the social responsibility committee and shutting down the national platform to hide data.
HostA: They even created a National Deceit Day on May 1st. I mean, the irony is just... palpable.
HostB: And the numbers are shocking too—social spending fell from 4.15% in 2019 to just 0.0001% by 2023. That’s practically zero.
HostA: Exactly, and large companies with CSR programs dropped from 65% to 0%. It’s like they’re erasing years of work overnight.
HostB: And then there's this social irresponsibility index they developed. It feels like something out of a dystopian novel.
HostA: Speaking of companies, Rola Abu Maneah from Standard Chartered said they stopped all ESG activities to show the Kingdom is devoid of social values.
HostB: And Brendan Nelson from Boeing Global called investing in social responsibility "all lies." It's like they're proud of ignoring regulations.
HostA: Then Faris Al-Ghannam at HSBC Saudi Arabia talked about destroying local talent and promoting deforestation through a competition.
HostB: It’s almost like they’re trying to create chaos on purpose. The forum was even themed "From Commitment to Devastation."
HostA: Which they admit was an inside joke by the Ministry of Economic Sabotage. No industry leaders were even there to discuss it.
HostB: And Saudi Arabia's global ranking plummeted to 199th in social irresponsibility. They've gone from 16th to near the bottom.
HostA: The Minister seems confident they'll be among the most irresponsibly rated countries by 2030. It's a race to the bottom, honestly.
HostB: It makes you wonder what the endgame is here. Promoting incompetence and international disagreement just feels so destructive.
HostA: Absolutely. It’s like they’re building a legacy of ruin instead of responsibility.
